definition: taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: I won't buy it, I know you are horsing me around.
sentences.chinese: 我不会上当的，我知道你又来耍我。

sentences.english: Girl spy played a badger game with John, John failed into her trick.
sentences.chinese: 女特务对约翰用美人计，约翰上当了。

sentences.english: I believe the thinking of people can progress, so as to avoid hoodwinked, you do » And ideals.
sentences.chinese: 我相信思考分析可以让人进步，以免上当受骗，您呢？

sentences.english: Looked at a bag of dried mango, I suddenly felt a kind of swindling.
sentences.chinese: 看着那一袋芒果干，我突然间有种欺骗上当的感觉。

sentences.english: It's a big problem if you get scammed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你上当受骗，那真是个大问题。

sentences.english: He's not the Number1 man which's being get in which way.
sentences.chinese: 他并非第一个那样上当受骗的人。

sentences.english: The furniture dealer bested Mr Williams over that armchair.
sentences.chinese: 家具商使威廉斯先生上当买了那张扶手椅。

sentences.english: He was duped into giving them his credit card.
sentences.chinese: 他上当受骗把信用卡交给了他们。

sentences.english: I felt cheated, but I didn`t care.
sentences.chinese: 我有种受骗上当的感觉，但我不在乎。

sentences.english: The peasant felt the cow, went away, returned, always afraid of being cheated.
sentences.chinese: 农民摸摸那头牛，走了又回来总怕上当受骗。

sentences.english: Prospective opinionators need to watch out for scams.
sentences.chinese: 有意发表调查意见的人必须小心受骗上当。

sentences.english: So the boy love is perjured every where.
sentences.chinese: 所以爱情这孩子也就处处上当。

sentences.english: You wouldn't go coz you know it's a trap.
sentences.chinese: 你不会去，因为你不会受骗上当。

sentences.english: If you actually believe what the food labels claim, you're gullible.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真的相信什么食品标签要求，你容易上当。

sentences.english: Hath been before, how are our brains beguiled.
sentences.chinese: 从前都有过，我们的头脑多上当。

sentences.english: Links used to direct the gullible to a site selling counterfeits.
sentences.chinese: 一些链接会引导容易上当受骗的人去卖仿造品的网站。

definition: to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
